solution_line_template: The town had {initial_population} people then had a {growth_percent_num}% growth spurt increasing the population by {initial_population}*{growth_percent_decimal} = {population_increase} people

The town had {initial_population} people then they added {population_increase} people bringing the population to {initial_population}+{population_increase} = <<{initial_population}+{population_increase}={population_after_growth}>>{population_after_growth} people
There were {population_after_growth} people and {moved_away_percent_num}% moved away so it decreased by {population_after_growth}*{moved_away_percent_decimal} = {population_decrease}

The population was {population_after_growth} and {population_decrease} people moved away making the new population {population_after_growth}-{population_decrease} = <<{population_after_growth}-{population_decrease}={current_population}>>{current_population} people
